arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: This forms a portion of collection #5488 B. The guide to the entire collection is available here.

Series XCIX is arranged in 7 sub-series by Union file number.
Series C is arranged in 228 sub-series by Union file number.

did.unittitle: Recommendations for changes in Grand Lodge Constitution and Laws
Sub-Series 492-7. 1947 Convention. Grand President's Convention Report
Delete "From Whence We Came or Whither We Are Going" from Ritual
Administer Obligation to Chairmen of Local Protective Committee
Amend Ritual to provide installation ceremony for Chairman of Local Protective Committee
To increase mileage and per diem allowance to Delegates of 1947 Convention
To increase mileage and per diem allowance to Convention Delegates
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Unemployment Insurance Act
To support the Crosser Amendments to the Railroad Retirement and Unemployment Insurance Acts
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To provide benefits similar to Railroad Retirement and Unemployment Insurance Acts for employees of bus and truck industry
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To amend the Railroad Retirement Act
To provide grab-irons or steps in bunkers of refrigerator cars
To establish a National Labor Supreme Court
To extend Federal Employers' Liability Act to include employees of Railway Express Agency
To establish differential wage for night work
Grand Lodge to establish standard form for handling grievances
Grand President to devise a model Agreement
To place all excepted positions under all rules or relinquish jurisdiction
All Railway Express Agents at depots where fewer than 10 are employed to be placed under Clerks' Agreement
Instruct Grand President to obtain the same pass privileges for Express employees as are granted railroad employees
Express Messengers to be paid overtime for work in excess of 176 hours per month
Grand President to undertake to correct conditions in Express cars
To amend Section 6 of Railway Labor Act
All System Boards to serve notice for 40-hour week
Canadian System Boards to be composed of Officers, District Chairmen and Local Chairmen
All Agreements to be ratified by membership
To oppose Government-controlled strike vote in Canada
Support the union of all labor organizations to form a Canadian Labour Party
To bring about unity of all labor organizations.
To conclude revision of Canadian Pension Plan
Sick leave and vacation for Canadian employees
To oppose anti-labor legislation in United States and Canada
To establish a nationwide strike fund
To elect a full-time District Chairman in British Columbia
To affiliate American Federation of Labor with World Federation of Labor Unions.
To establish minimum of 8 hours at time and one-half for Sunday work
Vacations to be granted on seniority basis; 160-day provision to be eliminated
12 days' vacation for all based on seniority
List exceptions to rules following the rule
Place scheduled positions on excepted list
To include all Canadian Express workers
Extra pay for employees required to work positions to which not regularly assigned
Start and end shift at same point
Employee to be paid full rate while qualifying
Payment to messengers handling United States Mail
Time and one-half for all Sunday work
Grand Lodge to subscribe to "Labor" for all members
Time and one-half for all Sunday work
6 days' notice of reduction in force
All Agreements to be ratified by members
Recording secretaries to accept subscription to "Labor" in groups of ten or more at reduced rates
Married women to be laid off instead of others regardless of seniority
Vacations and sick leave for veterans
Express Agency to pay time and one-half for all willful violations of rules
To establish mileage rate for Express Messengers
Railway Express Agency to pay penalty rate for violation of rules
Business of System Boards to be handled on proportional basis
Payment for vacations not obtained by deceased employees
Vacation year to be between May 1 and September 1
National Agreement on wages and rules
Railroad Employees to be paid extra for Handling Pullman Company business
Retroactive pay adjustments to apply to members only
To establish a National Sick Leave Rule
Reaffirm Resolution adopted at St. Louis, Missouri in 1943
Memorial to members losing their lives in World War II
40-hour week; night differential; equalization of rates; liberalize Vacation Agreement
Restore pension rights lost by Canadians in Strike of 1918
Define vacation for each month worked; union shop
Eliminate Auxiliary Lodges and issue Brotherhood Charters
Continue separate Lodges and grant full rights to Colored members
Grand President to render an account of vote taken in ratification of Legislative Board Laws
Delegates not receiving free transportation to be reimbursed
Grand Lodge to provide printed form to be used in securing wage data
To eliminate holiday restriction on passes
To discontinue practice of requiring employees to return to work before being paid for vacation
Heirs of deceased employees to be paid for vacations not obtained before death
6 additional days' vacation after 25 years' seniority
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide increased annuities
Commending Grand Lodge Officers for passage of Crosser Act
All railroad L.C.L. business to be handled by Railway Express Agency
Increase vacation on basis of service
Require General Chairmen to attend at least one regular meeting of each lodge each year
Correct method of settling personal injury claims
Establish minimum pension of $100 per month
Equalize rates in Chicago Switching District
Pennsylvania Section. Auxiliary Lodges by Board of Adjustment for use in connection with Convention Resolution No. 141
Grant Local Lodges right to deny admission to visiting members
Endorse and support program for immediate entry of displaced Europeans
Authorize Grand President to establish and assist in support of Legislative Committees in sparsely populated states
Condemning State anti-labor legislation and commending State Legislative Boards
To support H.R. 2007 and S.J.R. 67, establishing Commission for Study of Legal Status of Women

To support H.R. 2007 and S.J.R. 67, establishing Commission for Study of Legal Status of Women. Transcript of Hearings Before House Judiciary Committee on Equal Rights Amendment to Constitution and Commission on Legal Status of Women
Establish minimum hourly wage of 65 cents per hour
To oppose H.R. 1639, amending Federal Employees' Liability Act
Endorse H.R. 2408, Increasing Parcel Post Rates
Protesting enactment of restrictive labor laws
Oppose Communist, Fascist and Nazi organizations.
To extend scope rules to cover entire craft or class
To provide greater safety and safeguard health of Express employees

Punitive rates for overtime, Sunday and holiday work
Better cooperation and coordination of efforts of Lodges and System Boards
Consolidations, coordinations, abandonments or dissolution of existing facilities

To cooperate in reducing loss or damage claims
Time and one-half pay for vacation not allowed when scheduled
To publish National Railroad Adjustment Board Awards in Bulletin
To issue referendum ballot on Crosser Act
Pay for holidays, double-time when worked
To amend Railroad Retirement and Unemployment Insurance Acts
Condemning Railway Express Agency attitude toward Blue Cross
Increase annuities under Railroad Retirement Act
To elect System Board Officers by referendum vote
Require approval of 51% of members to divide Lodge and Issue new Charter
To amend system of reporting per capita tax to Grand Lodge and System Boards
To elect System Board Officers by referendum vote
Protesting delay in handling grievances by National Railroad Adjustment Board
To establish Welfare Fund for transportation workers
Protesting treatment accorded veterans of World War II
To amalgamate railroad workers in United States and Canada
Pay for holidays, double-time when worked
Permit Local Chairmen in Joint Lodge to represent employees of more than one carrier
Messengers to accompany all Express cars worked en route
All Express to be handled by Express employees
Commending opening address and program of Grand President
Demand vacation credit for armed forces
Restore continuity of membership to furloughed members who were given withdrawal cards in Depression years
To establish retirement insurance system for full-time officers and employees of Grand Lodge and System Boards
To conduct newspaper and radio campaign against anti-labor legislation
Expressing appreciation to Pullman Company and Canadian Pacific and Canadian National Railways
Thanking Railway Companies, Hotels and other organizations for courtesies extended
Extending appreciation to citizens, city officials, Local Committee on Arrangements and Committee in Charge of Entertainment
